image.altText: Image of couple in front of cancelled and sign and Metricon label

items.synopsis: Metricon, the biggest builder in the country, has told some customers to pay painfully higher prices or risk losing their new homes and deposits in a contract nightmare affecting home owners.

title.children: Australia's biggest builder tells some customers to pay higher prices or risk losing their new homes and deposits

image.altText: A mass of cars with flashing lights packed into a narrow street

items.synopsis: Police say a fatal shooting in Canterbury early this morning is believed to be a targeted incident. It comes less than 24 hours after a separate incident where a lawyer was shot.

title.children: Man shot dead in latest 'targeted' attack in south-west Sydney

image.altText: A new underground metro railway line will be built between Parramatta and the Sydney CBD.

items.synopsis: It was billed as Australia's biggest public transport project but is the promise of four metro lines for Sydney just a pipe dream? Here's how the project began, the hurdles it's faced and where it's up to now.

title.children: Sydney's metro mayhem — what's gone wrong?

image.altText: Black and white photo of a bald Sinead O'Connor puffing out her cheeks with her head in her hands as she looks at the camera

items.synopsis: Irish singer-songwriter Sinéad O'Connor, who became a superstar in her mid-20s, dies at 56.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor, who topped charts in the 90s, dies aged 56

image.altText: A woman in a green top stands against a stone wall.

items.synopsis: Sarab was 11 when ISIS militants attacked her village and sold her into slavery. Five years later, she had been given to six different men. Now, she wants justice, writes Stephanie March.

title.children: Sarab claims a Melbourne man kept her and a friend as slaves. Now, they want justice

image.altText: Composite image of young girl and police members and a search dog.

items.synopsis: Police find suspected human remains in bushland in Tasmania's north-east and declare a crime scene at a separate property during the search for missing teen Shyanne-Lee Tatnell.

title.children: Suspected human remains found, crime scene declared in search for Shyanne-Lee Tatnell

image.altText: a tray of pills reflecting a woman's face

items.synopsis: The story of diet drugs is one full of miracle cures that often don't live up to the hype or come with serious side effects.

title.children: Animal extracts, undercover reporting and too many deaths: The troubled history of diet pills

image.altText: Greg Jenkins 1

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank is hiking interest rates — and hitting borrowers — to fight high inflation, but data suggests the fight is being undermined by big-spending baby boomers.

title.children: 'We're not paying the price': The boomers boosting inflation as the RBA lifts rates to fight it

image.altText: A close up shot of Kevin Spacey in glasses

items.synopsis: The Oscar-winning actor broke down in tears when the jury in London found him not guilty of nine sexual offence charges.

title.children: Actor Kevin Spacey weeps as London jury finds him not guilty of sexual offences against four men

image.altText: Former Chinese foreign minister Qin Gang scratches his left eyebrow with his left hand as he looks down through spectacles.

items.synopsis: China's youngest ever minister went on to become the country's shortest-serving foreign minister, lasting only 207 days before vanishing for a month and eventually having everything he had done in office removed from the government's records, writes Bang Xiao.

title.children: Qin Gang became a man erased from history by the Chinese Communist Party

image.altText: Jade Graham and her sister Analiese, their grandmother Jacquie Argent, and mother Denna. Background: Jacquiei's graduation photo

items.synopsis: From free university to 7.1 per cent indexation, we chart the cost of higher education through three generations.

title.children: Jacquie got her degree for free. Her daughter and two granddaughters owe $100k in HECS

image.altText: Ria Andriani wears a pale blue jumper, facing the camera in a portrait taken inside her home.

items.synopsis: Many Australian utility companies don't provide bills in accessible formats, and Australia's laws make it difficult to force them to.

title.children: Imagine getting a bill and not being able to read it. That's the reality for thousands of Australians like Ria

image.altText: A man in a white t-shirt standing in a fiery wreckage

items.synopsis: Every European summer, millions of tourists descend on Greece to island-hop. But this year, a raging fire sent thousands running for their lives.

title.children: 'Children were screaming, Mummy I don't want to die': How fire turned this Greek paradise into hell

image.altText: Bald man in army greens holding a gun in front of white wall.

items.synopsis: One of the top leaders in the Russian Army, Sergei Surovikin, has not been seen since the mutiny against the Kremlin last month. At first it seems odd, but it turns out General Surovikin is not who he seems.

title.children: Russian 'General Armageddon' Sergei Surovikin is missing — is he 'resting' or Resting In Peace?

image.altText: A Canadian player runs aqay from goal with arms spread, as dejected Irish defenders look on.

items.synopsis: The Olympic champions Canada get their Women's World Cup campaign back on track with a win in Perth. Earlier, Spain thrash Zambia at Eden Park and Japan beat Costa Rica at the Women's World Cup.

title.children: Canada eliminates 'heartbroken' Ireland in Perth after Women's World Cup wins for Spain and Japan

image.altText: Hunter Biden is smiling at the camera in front a crowd.

items.synopsis: US President Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden has pleaded not guilty to federal tax and gun charges, after a plea deal that was intended to resolve the allegations fell apart in court. Here's how a "period of turmoil" landed him in strife.

title.children: Hunter Biden has pleaded not guilty to tax and gun charges amid uncertainty over previous plea. Here's what we know about the case

image.altText: Chalmers points in front of his face. He's standing in front of flags.

items.synopsis: After this week's encouraging inflation figures, the task for the government now is to convince the electorate of two things: cost-of-living pressures will continue easing and it's not just thanks to the Reserve Bank, writes David Speers.

title.children: Inflation may be easing but the political arm-wrestle over the cost of living goes on

image.altText: Plasma donor at Australian Red Cross Blood Service

items.synopsis: An urgent nationwide search is underway for blood donors with a rare blood type to save an Adelaide mother waiting to undergo major surgery.

title.children: Donors needed to help Adelaide woman with rare blood type waiting for heart surgery

image.altText: A young woman stands outside in front of a tree, looking into camera with a serious expression.

items.synopsis: Australia's largest oil and gas company, Woodside Energy, threatens to sue individual activists for financial damages it claims to have suffered in a recent protest, leading to accusations it is trying to shut down environmental activism.

title.children: Woodside threatens to sue climate activists over stink-bomb protest

image.altText: composite macron blinken

items.synopsis: Two of the world's most powerful leaders have used speeches in the Pacific to reaffirm their countries' commitment to the region, as geopolitical competition intensifies.

title.children: Macron warns of 'Chinese naval bases' in New Caledonia, as Blinken calls out 'problematic' Beijing during Tonga trip

image.altText: People are seen in the lower part of the image wearing hard hats while the volcano erupts in the background.

items.synopsis: The trial over the deadly 2019 Whakaari White Island eruption has heard there was a 5 per cent chance multiple people would die during tours of the volcano.

title.children: One in 20 chance of a 'mass casualty event' on White Island, expert tells court

image.altText: A woman in a pool wearing a yellow cap and holding blue goggles looks up in disbelief.

items.synopsis: An amazing duel at the World Aquatics Championships in Japan, as Mollie O'Callaghan wins Australia's sixth gold of the week, breaking the world record and edging out teammate Ariarne Titmus.

title.children: Mollie O'Callaghan breaks world record, pipping Ariarne Titmus in epic women's 200m freestyle at world titles

image.altText: Chris Hipkins and Anthony Albanese standing at podiums at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Passport-free travel between Australia and New Zealand is still at least a year off, after talks between prime ministers Anthony Albanese and Chris Hipkins in Wellington.

title.children: Passport-free travel still a year off as Albanese sits down with New Zealand PM Hipkins

image.altText: Asian woman wearing black and white houndstooth jacket with sunglasses standing in front of a bronze lion.

items.synopsis: Australian man Chau Van Kham was released from a Vietnamese prison after serving four years of a 12-year sentence on terrorism charges this month. His lawyer, Dan Phuong Nguyen, has an incredible survival story of her own.

title.children: From refugee to human rights defender: The suburban lawyer who helped bring democracy activist Chau Van Kham home

image.altText: A bald man in black tshirt and woman with long dark hair and grey jumper work in a drycleaning facility surrounded by machinery.

items.synopsis: Inflation has slowed down again, with consumer prices up 6 per cent over the year to June, below most economists' forecasts and reducing the chance of an RBA rate rise next week.

title.children: Inflation falls faster than expected. Has the Reserve Bank already increased interest rates too far?

image.altText: Housing in the south Wollongong suburb of Shell Cove.

items.synopsis: NSW Planning Minister Paul Scully defends his decision to approve a 13,000-home development in the Wollondilly Shire with just 187 affordable dwellings, saying that adding more would be a cost to the developer.

title.children: Planning minister defends 'probably lower than what people expect' affordable housing in Appin development

image.altText: Police tape on a suburban Adelaide street.

items.synopsis: A pilot has been taken to hospital after a light aircraft crash near the border of South Australia and New South Wales.

title.children: Pilot injured in light plane crash near Broken Hill

image.altText: A composite image of two women.

items.synopsis: A childcare boss's decision after learning two of her staff had left a three-year-old on a bus in central Queensland for several hours has been credited with saving the girl's life.

title.children: Tears as women who left child on daycare bus sentenced over 'nightmare situation'

image.altText: Gordi Kirkbank-Ellis side-by-side with his brain scan

items.synopsis: The effect of head knocks over Gordi Kirkbank-Ellis's decades-long sporting career isn’t immediately obvious. That is, until you see what’s happening to his brain.

title.children: From the age of 4, Gordi played contact sports. See how it has impacted his brain

image.altText: Photograph outside the Australian Tax Office headquarters

items.synopsis: Following an ABC Investigation, the Australian Tax Office admits criminals have fraudulently claimed more than $557 million from the Commonwealth using an identity loophole.

title.children: ATO admits identity loophole exposed by the ABC tops half a billion dollars

image.altText: A house burnt by wildfire in the Sicilian village of Romitello

items.synopsis: Extreme weather has caused havoc across the Northern Hemisphere. Here's a look at how at how hardest-hit areas have been impacted by the current heatwave.

title.children: Hot-tub temperatures in Florida ocean and wild fires across Greece: See how the heatwave is playing out
